definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Hear the teacher say to start again for the money, I know it's spent his salary.
sentences.chinese: 聽到老師說又要開始罰錢，我就知道是他工資花完了。

sentences.english: Or not return the library book and have to pay the fine.
sentences.chinese: 或者是，圖書館的書沒還的話就要罰錢。

sentences.english: Most have paid if the smuggling of cotton, but also Faqian.
sentences.chinese: 大多數都要上交，如果走私棉花，還要罰錢。

sentences.english: Only if you wish to avoid paying by proving you are not at fault.
sentences.chinese: 除非你想不要罰錢，而去證明你沒錯。

sentences.english: If any screw of the school chair is missing, the student sitting on it will be fined.
sentences.chinese: 椅子上的螺絲釘如果不見了，學生是要被罰錢的。

sentences.english: You will get fined if you spit on the street.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在街上亂吐口水，你會被罰錢。

definition: to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
lit. the whip cannot reach (idiom); beyond one's influence/too far to be able to help
to treat as guilty those associated with an offender (family, neighbors etc)
